Monday, May 14, 2007























Poll: Most back Congress in war funding fight
Most Americans disagree with President Bush's decision to veto the war funding bill that contained a timetable for withdrawal from Iraq.
FULL STORY

•  Public sides with Congress on Iraq
•  Poll results
•  GOP lawmakers to Bush: Fix Iraq soon


























The Situation Room, weekdays 4 p.m. & 7 p.m. ET
Watch "The Situation Room," anchored by Wolf Blitzer, for complete, up-to-the minute coverage of the day's events. Tune in to "The Situation Room" weekdays from 4 to 6 p.m. and from 7 to 8 p.m. ET.

For a daily sneak preview of the show and an early read on the day's political news sign up for "The Situation Room" daily email newsletter at http://www.CNN.com/situationroom.






















Gonzales to panel: No new details
Democrats are shifting their attention on the botched firings of eight federal prosecutors from Attorney General Alberto Gonzales' fitness to head the Justice Department to the White House role in the dismissals.
FULL STORY






Cheney: We'll talk with Iran on Iraq
The U.S. said Sunday it is willing to talk to Iran if discussions deal only with Iraq, where the Bush administration says Tehran is undermining the Baghdad government and sending deadly roadside bombs.
FULL STORY






Giuliani reaffirms abortion position
Republican presidential candidate Rudy Giuliani urged conservatives to look past his support for abortion rights, arguing that differences on the issue shouldn't disqualify him from being the GOP's nominee.
FULL STORY






Congress probes Justice hiring
Investigators are looking into new allegations a top official at the Justice Department hired lawyers based on their political affiliations, charges that arose from a probe into the firing of federal prosecutors.
FULL STORY
